reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought this for a gift, pleasantly surprised.
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my disabled veteran father who I'm taking care of, he said he was really impressed with these headphones. He said the sound was excellent, hearing the tv as if he wasn't even wearing them. Volume control works just fine. Comfort is good, he said only his ears kinda started hurting after many long hours but that's kind of normal for wearing headphones in general. Great price and great quality. Would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value for the money and excellent overall
reviews.reviewText: I'm impressed. For $10 you can't get a better pair of over the ear headphones. I bought these to use in the city (NYC). I want something that will help keep my ears a bit warm during the winter months. Excellent sound and comfort. The price is so low, I'll probably buy more. If they break during rough use in the city, I'll get more. Highly recommended. I do have wired and wireless headphones that are multiple hundreds of dollars and I don't feel like I'm settling when using these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars If you have normal size or smaller ears it's very comfortable.
reviews.reviewText: Unfortunately for me I have a rather large head with ears to match. The headphones fit okay, but not really if you know what I mean. It's better than "on the ear"types in terms of comfort, but they count over the ear as noise canceling which is a deceptive abuse of that term in my opinion. One more thing, and lots of people are saying this too, the volume adjustment has issues. It seems to work okay when the headphones are plugged directly into my computer, but when plugged into my monitor's sound bar they become useless. The sound is okay for the price, so if you can live with the downsides go for it. It's cheap and it works. Is the best? Oh, that's a stupid question.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use these to listen to music, etc on my laptop. Clarity is good and they are comfortable to wear.Noise cancellation works well. The adjustable volume control on the wire is OK but can be difficultto engage. Worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Too loud and can't control the volume
reviews.reviewText: For the price, they are a good buy. I have large ears, and these fit comfortably. I haven't been able to change the volume on the headphones themselves.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic for the price
reviews.reviewText: These are excellent! The quality is better than I expected for this price point. The bass is very good and the overall fidelity is definitely good enough for casual music listening or calls. As a man with average ears they fit over my ears but not by a huge margin so if your ears are large it might be a little too small. They are a bit shallow where they cup your ears too so it can become uncomfortable if you use them for long periods of time, but it's not bad. The volume and pause buttons work, and the microphone is muffled but still fully intelligible. Overall worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Almost perfect. Genuinely awesome for 10 dollars, and easily worth more. Unfortunately, the volume control buttons on the cord don't work. If this is a make or break for you, then pass these headphones over. However, if you're looking for high quality audio at a low price, then these are definitely for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love the cord
reviews.reviewText: I use these headphones while I'm sewing and crafting, mainly sitting in a wheeled office chair. I use an extension cord for them so I have a little more room to move around and at times the headphone cord gets caught under the wheels of my chair. The cord covering is a sturdy fiber that doesn't get crushed by the wheels. My previous headphones were just rubber coated so not nearly as resistant to damage from a wheel.
